Activity: Arrive, settle in. Enjoy a cup of peppermint tea. Reflect on the week's accomplishments and challenges.
Check the help desk system for any urgent issues that need immediate attention. Review all open tickets and prioritize accordingly.
Follow up on any outstanding escalated issues. If a resolution is available, work with the appropriate team members to implement it and verify that it is working correctly.
Address any remaining tickets in the queue, focusing on providing clear and concise instructions to users and documenting all troubleshooting steps.
Review the internal knowledge base for any outdated or inaccurate information. Update the knowledge base with any new solutions or troubleshooting tips.
Meet with @ITPM-1 briefly to discuss any recurring issues or potential areas for improvement in the help desk process.
Lunch break. Enjoy a leisurely lunch and perhaps browse a bookstore.
Use any remaining time to focus on personal development by reading articles or watching videos related to help desk support, EHR systems, or IT troubleshooting.
Begin preparing a weekly report summarizing the help desk's activities, including the number of tickets received, the average resolution time, and the most common types of issues reported.
Review all documentation created throughout the week to ensure accuracy and completeness. Organize files and folders for easy access in the future.
Complete the weekly report and submit it to the appropriate team members.

Prepare for the end of the week by cleaning up the work area, organizing notes, and creating a list of tasks to be completed next week. Reflect on the week and acknowledge any areas where I can improve.
